Neem is a fast-growing, evergreen tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the mahogany family and is widely known for its resilience and medicinal properties. The leaves are serrated and bitter in taste, and the tree produces small white flowers and olive-like fruits 
 . 💊 Medicinal Uses of Neem: 
Acts as a natural antibacterial and antifungal agent

Used to treat skin conditions like eczema, acne, and psoriasis

Supports oral hygiene – neem twigs are traditionally used as toothbrushes

Neem oil is used to treat head lice and dandruff

Has anti-inflammatory properties helpful in joint pain and arthritis 
🌱 3) Benefits of Neem: 
Boosts Immunity: Helps purify the blood and strengthen immune response

Skincare: Reduces acne, pigmentation, and scars

Pest Control: Neem oil is an effective, eco-friendly pesticide

Hair Health: Fights scalp infections and promotes hair growth

Detoxification: Aids in flushing out toxins from the body ⭐ 
 Rating: 4.8 / 5 ⭐ Based on traditional use and modern research, neem is considered one of the most valuable medicinal plants.
